name: 李老师不是你老师

One person rushed into the district government, and a large number of people were on the roof. At the same time, some people also took pictures of police cars rushing to the scene.

Some additional videos and videos of SWAT entering the scene
In the video, you can see a lot of police cars, SWAT changing into protective clothing, registering ID cards, and a citizen bleeding from the head.
The specific situation is currently unknown. Some netizens said that no one died at the scene, and the previous rumor of being shot when rushing into the district government was false.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: In order to get nucleic acid test results within 24 hours, Beijing's office workers are looking for nucleic acid test sites that have not been cancelled. Migrant workers in Guangzhou rioted and overturned nucleic acid test sites because they could not lift the lockdown.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
This seems to be another very clever and stupid move. The relatively liberal south insists on zeroing out, while the relatively conservative north tries to relax.
This is a way of balancing yin and yang that old Chinese men talk about most.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: @foxriverman stop being too emotional

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: I have always felt that the 2019 Hong Kong anti-extradition propaganda war is a topic that is very worthy of study. It is a textbook example of how to use media and information control to stigmatize reasonable demands, and ultimately cleverly transform the violence machine from the role of a perpetrator to the role of a victim, and how to successfully transform a political crisis into a large-scale patriotic education.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: @EricLiu_USA What is the golden finger

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Most people don't care about these things, they think that the present is very good and developed. They used to live in small bungalows, but now they live in high-rise buildings with elevators. The illusion of material life and the illusion of media propaganda have jointly created a great and brilliant utopia. What freedom and democracy are needed? The streets are full of posters of freedom, democracy, happiness and harmony. I'm tired of seeing them. I have always said that the China problem is an unsolvable problem, and many people are unwilling to admit this. I will offend you again today.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Take Ukraine for example. Europe and Russia have an energy lifeline relationship. Why did they still try their best to help Ukraine?
If there was no resistance at the beginning, and most people thought that joining Russia would not matter, would there be the following plots? It would have been gone long ago. Putin went directly to Kiev for inspection.
It's just such a simple truth
Whether others help you or not depends on the interests, but the key point is whether you are worth helping.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Oh, the world is now in tune with you, congratulations, now you can call America Daddy, Germany Daddy, and Australia Daddy, you’re welcome.

Red to purple is the new normal
I suggest that everyone be mentally prepared in advance.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
I'm very curious about one thing.
It's clear that the city has been relaxed, the government said it will not do nucleic acid tests, all places will not do nucleic acid tests, and nucleic acid test sites have been withdrawn.
But some places are still checking, and the people tacitly allow them to check. Not only do they not argue with reason and ask them not to check, but they are looking for nucleic acid test sites all over the streets.
Why is this?

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: For example, in Beijing, Shijiazhuang, and Guangzhou, some netizens said that the nucleic acid test sites were withdrawn, but they were still asked to take nucleic acid test when entering shopping malls or other places, which forced them to queue up and pay for the test at their own expense. So everyone called on the government to quickly bring back the nucleic acid test sites, otherwise life would be too inconvenient. Is it possible to just cancel those places that still insist on requiring nucleic acid test certificates?
